TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit MembershipUserCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public NotInheritable Class MembershipUserCollection Implements ICollection
public ref class MembershipUserCollection sealed : System::Collections::ICollection
type MembershipUserCollection = class interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> is returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByEmail%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership?displayProperty=nameWithType> class. The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> objects returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByEmail%2A> methods contain a snapshot of user information in the membership data store. That is, changes to the membership user information in a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are not reflected in the membership data store. To modify membership user information in the membership data store, use the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership?displayProperty=nameWithType> class.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980(v=vs.100)) before continuing. For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd).
## Examples The following code example returns a list of membership users with a count of the number of users currently online. For an example of an ASP.NET application configured to use membership, see the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership> class.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider/CS/ShowUserscs.aspx#5)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider/VB/ShowUsersvb.aspx#5)]

Docs.summary: Creates a new, empty membership user collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> is constructed by membership provider implementers and returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.GetAllUsers%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.FindUsersByName%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> abstract class.
## Examples The following code example shows a sample <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.GetAllUsers%2A> implementation.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.IMembershipProvider#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.IMembershipProvider/CS/imembershipprovidergetallusers.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.IMembershipProvider#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.IMembershipProvider/VB/imembershipprovidergetallusers.vb#15)]

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator that can iterate through the membership user collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Enumerators only allow reading the data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to iterate through a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection>.

Docs.summary: Gets the membership user in the collection referenced by the specified user name.
Docs.value: A object representing the user specified by .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> object returned by <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.Item%2A> property contains a snapshot of user information in the membership data store. That is, changes to the membership user information in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are not reflected in the membership data store. To modify membership user information in the membership data store, use the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example displays all membership user names in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> and shows specific membership information for the selected user name.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection/CS/itemcs.aspx#2)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection/VB/itemvb.aspx#2)]

Docs.related: Managing Users By Using ASP.NET Membership

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetReadOnly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Makes the contents of the membership user collection read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The contents of a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are considered read-only, as they are a snapshot of the membership user information in the membership data store. Membership user information is modified using the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods. The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.SetReadOnly%2A> method marks the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> as read-only so that <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> objects cannot be added to or removed from the collection. Property values for the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> objects are not marked as read-only. That is, you can modify the property values of a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> regardless of whether the collection has been marked as read-only by the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection.SetReadOnly%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example returns all of the users from the membership data store. The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> returned is marked as read-only based on a `Boolean` parameter specified by the caller.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection/CS/snippetscs.aspx#5)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection/VB/snippetsvb.aspx#5)]

Docs.related: Managing Users By Using ASP.NET Membership
